text: on friday the egyptian foreign minister
Nabil Elaraby announced that Egypt was
going to open its border permanently
with gaza gaza which is run by Hamas the
Palestinian movement has been under a
blockade that Israel had urged upon
Egypt and has been imposing from its
side of the border of Gaza for several
years because Hamas is an Islamist
organization opposed to the existence of
Israel mr. Larabee is the new Egyptian
Foreign Minister who's been brought in
in the post Hosni Mubarak government and
that government is saying it wants to
have a much less pro-israel foreign
policy and is going to start at least
with this as well as with exchanging
ambassadors between egypt and iran
egypt's getting closer to hamas is also
an important factor because mr. mubarak
was very strongly opposed to Hamas and
this relationship between Egypt and
Hamas has created the conditions for
Hamas and Fatah which runs the West Bank
under President Mahmoud Abbas to come
together and talk about a unity
government the two sides mr. Abbas and
mr. miss Xiao for Hamas are going to
meet in Cairo on Wednesday and sign a
unity agreement
all of these forces are evidence of the
revolution in Egypt and the creation of
a new Egyptian government its impact on
the Palestinians and on Israel and of
course has got the Israelis very nervous
about the loss of a key ally
